title: NASA found 7 new Earth-like planets which is great news because I’m super sick of this one | For The Win
text:
Follow @hemjhaveri 
Good news if the state of our current planet is starting to wear you down! 
NASA announced on Wednesday afternoon that they’ve discovered “the first known system of seven Earth-size planets around a single star.” 
According to NASA , of the seven planets, three are “firmly located in the habitable zone,” which means they have the highest chance of having liquid water, which is (duh) pretty essential for sustaining human life. 
NASA stresses that this brings us so much closer to potentially answering the question of whether or not we’re alone in the universe. 
“This discovery could be a significant piece in the puzzle of finding habitable environments, places that are conducive to life,” said Thomas Zurbuchen, associate administrator of the agency’s Science Mission Directorate in Washington. “Answering the question ‘are we alone’ is a top science priority and finding so many planets like these for the first time in the habitable zone is a remarkable step forward toward that goal.” 
Discovered by NASA’s Spitzer Space Telescope, the planets are about 40 light-years (235 trillion miles) from Earth in the constellation Aquarius. By space standards, this is apparently not that far. 
Also, these planets look dope! Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech 
I mean, why wouldn’t you want to live on this? Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech 
As interesting as it would be to find life elsewhere in the universe, I’m excited to have (potentially) seven new Earth-like planets for us to escape too since the current one we’re on is soon going to be uninhabitable. Political discontent, climate change and unrelenting religious strife don’t really bode well for our survival here. 
Plus, I’ve seen Interstellar and watched The Martian several times over. I’m pretty sure I can nail this surviving on a new world thing. Also, I am very tiny and my space pod would weigh a negligible amount. Plus, I think I can talk Chris Evans into becoming a fellow colonizer. How fun would that be?
